results.title: Moving to Maldon
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eric and Debra Watson came to Maldon for a long weekend, walked around and fell in love with the town. They saw a church for sale and three days later purchased it and moved from Melbourne. The town felt like home from their first visit and while they feel close enough to the city, their kids have the chance of growing up in a safe country environment where they can walk everywhere and just be kids.

results.title: Shani
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dynamic 18 year old Shani Aziz is a hip hop dancer living in the small town of Maldon where she runs the local fish and chip shop with her mother. She started hip hop dancing with her brother as something fun to do but it has become her passion leading her to start a not-for-profit group to empower young people. She is an inspirational teacher offering the youth of the small Victorian town an outlet for fun and self expression.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

results.title: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maurie Gervasoni’s grandfather settled in Newstead during the Victorian gold rush in the 1860’s and quickly designed and built a family estate. A love of music and dancing made the Yandoit houses a destination for vibrant country living. The stone house and former stables presently sit as a relic, but Maurie hopes that one day the place will be restored to its former glory.
results.title_for_label: The Gervasoni Family Estate: life in the Yandoit houses

results.title: Newstead Community Garden
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: When the town of Newstead held a summit in 2008, the idea of a community garden grew out of it. With the help of a grant and the support of locals and volunteers, the land surrounding the All Saints Anglican Church has become a thriving biodynamic garden. It is a great place for the community to come together, dig and get to know one another.

results.title: Theatre Royal: Castlemaine
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: A Castlemaine icon, the Theatre Royal is one of the oldest theatres in the country dating back to 1858. The owner in 2010, the projectionist, a burlesque performer and a local regular patron talk about their cinematic experiences, the history of the building, its architectural delights and how it is a major social centre for the town. Changing with the times, this is not only a single screen cinema, it offers music nights, community events, artist markets and even boasts a theatre ghost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

results.title: Castlemaine Community Lunch
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Castlemaine Community Lunch is a weekly event organised by the Castlemaine Community House. It brings people together in a warm and welcoming environment, encouraging and nurturing friendships and connections. Attended by locals, old and new, it is also a chance to welcome newcomers into the community.

Attended by locals, old and new, it is also a chance to welcome newcomers into the community.

results.title: Castlemaine artists
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Castlemaine boasts a thriving art scene from emerging to established artists. This film introduces us to some of these artists; including mosaic artists, musicians, painters, and printmakers; and takes us through the creative spaces in which they work. They discuss how their immediate environment has influenced their art and how the many artistic hubs become vibrant gathering spaces for the community.

results.title: Turmoil [game trailer]
results.brief_description:
This challenging platform game takes place in the year 3000, amid environmental chaos. Your task is to deliver the final piece of a time machine that will allow scientists to travel to the past to introduce sustainable thinking practices.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.
